title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behaviour participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behaviour may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (http://contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available http://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Small typos grammatical errors documentation may edited directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. E.g. edit roxygen2 comment .R file R/, .Rd file man/.

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: make substantial pull request, always file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s problem. ’ve found bug, create associated issue illustrate bug minimal reproducible example.

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: recommend create Git branch pull request (PR). Look GitHub Actions build status making changes. README contain badges continuous integration services used package. require tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2. use testthat. Contributions test cases included easier accept. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md current development version header describing changes made followed GitHub username, links relevant issue(s)/PR(s).

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Please note project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Email person listed maintainer DESCRIPTION file repo. Though note private discussions email don’t help others - course email totally warranted ’s sensitive problem kind.

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: contributing guide adapted tidyverse contributing guide available https://raw.githubusercontent.com/r-lib/usethis/master/inst/templates/tidy-contributing.md

title: Default colours along a variable in INBOtheme
text: themes impact scales using colour fill along variable. vignette focusses different styles colour scales. fill scales uses gradients. keep vignette small, give examples different colours. illustrate effects themes vignette("colour", package = "INBOtheme"), keep size vignettes minimum. Note need use appropriate scale provided INBOtheme case gradient along continuous variable.
code: library(ggplot2) library(INBOtheme)

title: Default colours along a variable in INBOtheme
text: Coloured along continuous variable. Coloured along continuous variable using gradient midpoint.
code: ggplot(diamonds, aes(x = carat, y = depth, colour = price)) +   geom_point() +   scale_colour_gradient() ggplot(diamonds, aes(x = carat, y = depth, colour = price)) +   geom_point() +   scale_colour_gradient2(midpoint = 1e4)

title: Default colours along a variable in INBOtheme
text: Coloured along ordinal variable.
code: ggplot(diamonds, aes(x = carat, y = depth, colour = cut)) +   geom_point()

title: Default colours along a variable in INBOtheme
text: illustrate figures different number categories. choose scatter plots random x, y category. difficult situation distinguish colours. careful use 5 colours. Coloured two level categorical variable. Coloured three level categorical variable. Coloured four level categorical variable. Coloured five level categorical variable. Coloured six level categorical variable. Coloured seven level categorical variable. Coloured eight level categorical variable.
code: data.frame(   x = runif(1e3), y = runif(1e3),   category = sample(LETTERS[1:2], 1e3, replace = TRUE) ) |>   ggplot(aes(x = x, y = y, colour = category)) +   geom_jitter() data.frame(   x = runif(1e3), y = runif(1e3),   category = sample(LETTERS[1:3], 1e3, replace = TRUE) ) |>   ggplot(aes(x = x, y = y, colour = category)) +   geom_jitter() data.frame(   x = runif(1e3), y = runif(1e3),   category = sample(LETTERS[1:4], 1e3, replace = TRUE) ) |>   ggplot(aes(x = x, y = y, colour = category)) +   geom_jitter() data.frame(   x = runif(1e3), y = runif(1e3),   category = sample(LETTERS[1:5], 1e3, replace = TRUE) ) |>   ggplot(aes(x = x, y = y, colour = category)) +   geom_jitter() data.frame(   x = runif(1e3), y = runif(1e3),   category = sample(LETTERS[1:6], 1e3, replace = TRUE) ) |>   ggplot(aes(x = x, y = y, colour = category)) +   geom_jitter() data.frame(   x = runif(1e3), y = runif(1e3),   category = sample(LETTERS[1:7], 1e3, replace = TRUE) ) |>   ggplot(aes(x = x, y = y, colour = category)) +   geom_jitter() data.frame(   x = runif(1e3), y = runif(1e3),   category = sample(LETTERS[1:8], 1e3, replace = TRUE) ) |>   ggplot(aes(x = x, y = y, colour = category)) +   geom_jitter()

title: Available colour palettes in INBOtheme
text: vignette demonstrates available colour palettes INBOtheme package. show palette plot numbered rectangles. number indicates order palette.
code: library(INBOtheme)

title: Available colour palettes in INBOtheme
text: available colors inbo_palette() colours inbo_palette() side side.

title: Available colour palettes in INBOtheme
text: Available colours vlaanderen_palette() colours vlaanderen_palette() side side.

title: Available colour palettes in INBOtheme
text: Note traffic_palette() variable number colours. starts dark red colour changes light green colour. Going gradually dark light makes palette readable colour blind people. available colours traffic_palette(9) traffic_palette() 9 levels. available colours traffic_palette(3) traffic_palette() 3 levels.

title: Available colour palettes in INBOtheme
text: ordinal_palette() variable number colours. starts dark colour end light colour. colours intermediate colours, resulting gradient dark light. colours depend active ggplot2 theme. ordinal_palette(5) theme_inbo(). ordinal_palette(5) theme_inbo(). ordinal_palette(5) theme_vlaanderen2015(). ordinal_palette(5) theme_vlaanderen2015(). ordinal_palette(5) theme_elsevier(). ordinal_palette(5) theme_elsevier().

title: Available colour palettes in INBOtheme
text: available named colours INBO. named colours INBO side side.
code: inbo_named <- c(   inbo_donkerblauw, inbo_munt, inbo_oranjerood, inbo_grijsblauw,   inbo_lichtgroen, inbo_groen, inbo_lichtgrijs, inbo_kaki, inbo_felrood,   inbo_steun_blauw, inbo_geelgr, inbo_steun_geelgroen, inbo_steun_donkerroos,   inbo_donkergroen, inbo_oranje, inbo_geel, inbo_lichtblauw, inbo_hoofd,   inbo_rood, inbo_grijs, inbo_bruinrood, inbo_oranje, inbo_groen ) show_palette(inbo_named)

title: Available colour palettes in INBOtheme
text: available named colours Flanders. named colours Flanders side side.
code: vl_named <- c(   vl_black, vl_darkblue, vl_darkbrown, vl_darkgreen, vl_darkred, vl_darkyellow,   vl_grey1, vl_grey2, vl_grey3, vl_grey4, vl_grey5, vl_grey6, vl_grey7,   vl_lightblue, vl_lightbrown, vl_lightgreen, vl_lightred, vl_yellow ) show_palette(vl_named)

title: Available themes in INBOtheme
text: vignette focuses available ggplot2 themes INBOtheme. mainly control looks axes, background, legend, … themes also impact schemes using colour fill along variable. illustrate vignette("colour", package = "INBOtheme").

title: Available themes in INBOtheme
text: ggplot2 package must loaded prior INBOtheme. Loading INBOtheme sets inbo_theme() default theme inbo_steun_blauw default colour geoms. Note use theme_set() switch_colour(). applies theme colour subsequent plots without need change ggplot2 code.

what: Using the default theme from INBOtheme
title: Available themes in INBOtheme
text: Add following code loading ggplot2 tidyverse package creating ggplot2 plots. case need change default font size background add code loading package.
code: library(INBOtheme) theme_set(theme_inbo(base_size = 12, transparent = FALSE))

what: Using a non-default theme from INBOtheme
title: Available themes in INBOtheme
text: Add following code loading ggplot2 tidyverse package creating ggplot2 plots.
code: library(INBOtheme) theme_set(theme_vlaanderen2015(base_size = 12, transparent = FALSE)) switch_colour(vl_darkyellow) library(INBOtheme) theme_set(theme_elsevier(base_size = 12, transparent = FALSE)) switch_colour("black")

title: Available themes in INBOtheme
code: library(ggplot2) library(INBOtheme) # Prepare the data for the figures d <- data.frame(   x = "Sphinx of black quartz, judge my vow",   y = "Sphinx of\nblack quartz,\njudge my vow" ) data("esoph") cancer <- esoph cancer$Age <- cancer$agegp cancer$Alcohol <- cancer$alcgp cancer$Tabacco <- cancer$tobgp cancer$Proportion <- cancer$ncases / (cancer$ncases + cancer$ncontrols)

title: Available themes in INBOtheme
text: Testing fonts. geom_boxplot() Histogram split subplots facet_wrap(). Histogram split subplots facet_grid().
code: theme_set(theme_inbo(base_size = 12)) switch_colour(inbo_steun_blauw) ggplot(d, aes(x = x, y = x, label = y)) +   geom_text(size = 8) +   labs(x = d$x, y = d$x, title = d$x, colour = d$y) +   theme(axis.text.y = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 0.5)) ggplot(cancer, aes(x = Age, y = Proportion)) +   geom_boxplot() +   ggtitle("cancer dataset") ggplot(cancer, aes(x = Proportion)) +   geom_histogram(binwidth = 0.05) +   facet_wrap(~Age, scales = "free") +   ggtitle("cancer dataset") ggplot(cancer, aes(x = Proportion)) +   geom_histogram(binwidth = 0.05) +   facet_grid(alcgp ~ tobgp, scales = "free") +   ggtitle("cancer dataset")

title: Available themes in INBOtheme
text: Testing fonts. geom_boxplot() Histogram split subplots facet_wrap(). Histogram split subplots facet_grid().
code: theme_set(theme_inbo(base_size = 12, transparent = TRUE)) switch_colour(inbo_steun_blauw) ggplot(d, aes(x = x, y = x, label = y)) +   geom_text(size = 8) +   labs(x = d$x, y = d$x, title = d$x, colour = d$y) +   theme(axis.text.y = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 0.5)) ggplot(cancer, aes(x = Age, y = Proportion)) +   geom_boxplot() +   ggtitle("cancer dataset") ggplot(cancer, aes(x = Proportion)) +   geom_histogram(binwidth = 0.05) +   facet_wrap(~Age, scales = "free") +   ggtitle("cancer dataset") ggplot(cancer, aes(x = Proportion)) +   geom_histogram(binwidth = 0.05) +   facet_grid(alcgp ~ tobgp, scales = "free") +   ggtitle("cancer dataset")

title: Available themes in INBOtheme
text: Testing fonts. geom_boxplot() Histogram split subplots facet_wrap(). Histogram split subplots facet_grid().
code: theme_set(theme_vlaanderen2015(base_size = 12)) switch_colour(vl_darkyellow) ggplot(d, aes(x = x, y = x, label = y)) +   geom_text(size = 8) +   labs(x = d$x, y = d$x, title = d$x, colour = d$y) +   theme(axis.text.y = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 0.5)) ggplot(cancer, aes(x = Age, y = Proportion)) +   geom_boxplot() +   ggtitle("cancer dataset") ggplot(cancer, aes(x = Proportion)) +   geom_histogram(binwidth = 0.05) +   facet_wrap(~Age, scales = "free") +   ggtitle("cancer dataset") ggplot(cancer, aes(x = Proportion)) +   geom_histogram(binwidth = 0.05) +   facet_grid(alcgp ~ tobgp, scales = "free") +   ggtitle("cancer dataset")

code: theme_set(theme_vlaanderen2015(base_size = 12, transparent = TRUE)) switch_colour(vl_darkyellow) ggplot(d, aes(x = x, y = x, label = y)) +   geom_text(size = 8) +   labs(x = d$x, y = d$x, title = d$x, colour = d$y) +   theme(axis.text.y = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 0.5)) ggplot(cancer, aes(x = Age, y = Proportion)) +   geom_boxplot() +   ggtitle("cancer dataset") ggplot(cancer, aes(x = Proportion)) +   geom_histogram(binwidth = 0.05) +   facet_wrap(~Age, scales = "free") +   ggtitle("cancer dataset") ggplot(cancer, aes(x = Proportion)) +   geom_histogram(binwidth = 0.05) +   facet_grid(alcgp ~ tobgp, scales = "free") +   ggtitle("cancer dataset")

title: Available themes in INBOtheme
text: Note theme_elsevier() uses base font size 7. Use default preparing plots paper. Testing fonts. geom_boxplot() Histogram split subplots facet_wrap(). Histogram split subplots facet_grid().
code: theme_set(theme_elsevier(base_size = 12)) switch_colour("black") ggplot(d, aes(x = x, y = x, label = y)) +   geom_text(size = 8) +   labs(x = d$x, y = d$x, title = d$x, colour = d$y) +   theme(axis.text.y = element_text(angle = 90, hjust = 0.5)) ggplot(cancer, aes(x = Age, y = Proportion)) +   geom_boxplot() +   ggtitle("cancer dataset") ggplot(cancer, aes(x = Proportion)) +   geom_histogram(binwidth = 0.05) +   facet_wrap(~Age, scales = "free") +   ggtitle("cancer dataset") ggplot(cancer, aes(x = Proportion)) +   geom_histogram(binwidth = 0.05) +   facet_grid(alcgp ~ tobgp, scales = "free") +   ggtitle("cancer dataset")

title: Authors and Citation
text: Thierry Onkelinx. Author, maintainer.            Research Institute Nature Forest (INBO) Oona Op de Weerdt. Contributor. Nicole De Groof. Contributor.            Research Institute Nature Forest (INBO) . Copyright holder, funder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Onkelinx, Thierry (2025) INBOtheme: Themes ggplot2. Version 0.6.1. https://inbo.github.io/INBOtheme/
code: @Manual{,   title = {INBOtheme: Themes for ggplot2. Version 0.6.1},   author = {Thierry Onkelinx},   year = {2025},   url = {https://inbo.github.io/INBOtheme/},   abstract = {Several themes for the ggplot2 package. Among others themes complying with the style guide for the Research Institute for Nature and Forest (INBO) and Elsevier journals.},   keywords = {ggplot2; theme; style guide}, }

title: Themes for ggplot2
text: help files vignettes available https://inbo.github.io/INBOtheme

title: Themes for ggplot2
text: latest version package available INBO R universe. Another option install package GitHub.
code: # Enable the INBO universe options(   repos = c(     inbo = "https://inbo.r-universe.dev", CRAN = "https://cloud.r-project.org"   ) ) # Install the package install.packages("INBOtheme") if (!"remotes" %in% rownames(installed.packages())) {   install.packages("remotes") } # install the latest version remotes::install_github("inbo/INBOtheme") # install a specific release # see https://github.com/inbo/INBOtheme/releases remotes::install_github("inbo/INBOtheme@v0.5.8")

title: Themes for ggplot2
text: ggplot2 package nice easy system apply themes. INBOtheme packages contains themes Research Institute Nature Forest, Flemish government Elsevier journals. documentation available https://inbo.github.io/INBOtheme. includes set example figures available theme.

title: Themes for ggplot2
text: folder structure typical R packages mandatory R folder (definition functions) man (helpfiles Rd format). max-roxygen contains templates help files. inst contains auxiliary scripts stored. test folder contains unit tests using infrastructure testthat package. vignette folder contains examples available themes.
code: INBOtheme ├── inst ├── man ├── man-roxygen ├── R ├─┬ tests │ └── testthat └── vignettes

what: Calculate a distance matrix between colours for colour blind people — colour_blind_distance
title: Calculate a distance matrix between colours for colour blind people — colour_blind_distance
text: function calculates distance matrices every option. aggregates matrices single distance matrix.

title: Calculate a distance matrix between colours for colour blind people — colour_blind_distance
code: colour_blind_distance(   colours,   deutan = TRUE,   protan = FALSE,   tritan = FALSE,   gray = FALSE,   fun = min,   method = "emd" )

title: Calculate a distance matrix between colours for colour blind people — colour_blind_distance
text: colours vector colours deutan correct deuteranomaly (red - green colour blindness). Defaults TRUE. protan correct protanopia (red - green colour blindness). Defaults FALSE. tritan correct tritanopia (blue - yellow colour blindness). Defaults FALSE. gray correct monochromacy (unable distinguish colours). Defaults FALSE. fun Function aggregate different colour distance matrices. method passed colordistance::getColorDistanceMatrix()

what: Calculate a distance matrix between colours — colour_distance
title: Calculate a distance matrix between colours — colour_distance
text: Calculate distance matrix colours

title: Calculate a distance matrix between colours — colour_distance
code: colour_distance(colours, method = "emd")

title: Calculate a distance matrix between colours — colour_distance
text: colours vector colours method passed colordistance::getColorDistanceMatrix()

what: Standard dimensions for the Elsevier style guide — page_height
title: Standard dimensions for the Elsevier style guide — page_height
text: Several standard dimensions Elsevier style guide -page_height Maximal height figure (inch). -page_width Width figure covering two columns (inch). -column_width Width figure covering one column (inch). -medium_width Width figure covering 1.5 columns (inch).

title: redefine ggplot2::scale_colour_gradient() — scale_colour_gradient
text: Selects colours depending current set theme.

title: redefine ggplot2::scale_colour_gradient() — scale_colour_gradient
code: scale_colour_gradient(   ...,   low,   high,   space = "Lab",   na.value = "grey50",   guide = "colourbar",   aesthetics = "colour" )  scale_color_gradient(   ...,   low,   high,   space = "Lab",   na.value = "grey50",   guide = "colourbar",   aesthetics = "colour" )

title: redefine ggplot2::scale_colour_gradient() — scale_colour_gradient
text: ... Arguments passed continuous_scale scale_name name scale used error messages associated scale. palette palette function called numeric vector values 0 1 returns corresponding output values (e.g., scales::pal_area()). breaks One : NULL breaks waiver() default breaks computed transformation object numeric vector positions function takes limits input returns breaks output (e.g., function returned scales::extended_breaks()). Note position scales, limits provided scale expansion. Also accepts rlang lambda function notation. minor_breaks One : NULL minor breaks waiver() default breaks (one minor break major break) numeric vector positions function given limits returns vector minor breaks. Also accepts rlang lambda function notation. function two arguments, given limits major breaks. n.breaks integer guiding number major breaks. algorithm may choose slightly different number ensure nice break labels. effect breaks = waiver(). Use NULL use default number breaks given transformation. labels One : NULL labels waiver() default labels computed transformation object character vector giving labels (must length breaks) expression vector (must length breaks). See ?plotmath details. function takes breaks input returns labels output. Also accepts rlang lambda function notation. limits One : NULL use default scale range numeric vector length two providing limits scale. Use NA refer existing minimum maximum function accepts existing (automatic) limits returns new limits. Also accepts rlang lambda function notation. Note setting limits positional scales remove data outside limits. purpose zoom, use limit argument coordinate system (see coord_cartesian()). rescaler function used scale input values range [0, 1]. always scales::rescale(), except diverging n colour gradients (.e., scale_colour_gradient2(), scale_colour_gradientn()). rescaler ignored position scales, always use scales::rescale(). Also accepts rlang lambda function notation. oob One : Function handles limits outside scale limits (bounds). Also accepts rlang lambda function notation. default (scales::censor()) replaces bounds values NA. scales::squish() squishing bounds values range. scales::squish_infinite() squishing infinite values range. trans Deprecated favour transform. call call used construct scale reporting messages. super super class use constructed scale low Colour low end gradient high Colour high end gradient space colour space calculate gradient. Must "Lab" - values deprecated. na.value Colour use missing values guide Type legend. Use "colourbar" continuous colour bar, "legend" discrete colour legend. aesthetics Character string vector character strings listing name(s) aesthetic(s) scale works . can useful, example, apply colour settings colour fill aesthetics time, via aesthetics = c("colour", "fill").

title: redefine ggplot2::scale_colour_gradient() — scale_colour_gradient
text: Thierry Onkelinx, Oona Op de Weerdt, Nicole De Groof

text: Selects colours depending current set theme.

code: scale_colour_gradient2(   ...,   low,   high,   mid,   midpoint = 0,   space = "Lab",   guide = "colourbar",   na.value = "grey50",   aesthetics = "colour" )  scale_color_gradient2(   ...,   low,   high,   mid,   midpoint = 0,   space = "Lab",   guide = "colourbar",   na.value = "grey50",   aesthetics = "colour" )

title: redefine ggplot2::scale_fill_discrete() — scale_fill_discrete
text: ... Additional parameters passed scale type, type One following: character vector color codes. codes used 'manual' color scale long number codes exceeds number data levels (levels codes, scale_colour_hue()/scale_fill_hue() used construct default scale). named vector, color values matched levels based names vectors. Data values match set na.value. list character vectors color codes. minimum length vector exceeds number data levels chosen color scaling. useful want change color palette based number levels. function returns discrete colour/fill scale (e.g., scale_fill_hue(), scale_fill_brewer(), etc).

Also accepts rlang lambda function notation. default (scales::censor()) replaces bounds values NA. scales::squish() squishing bounds values range. scales::squish_infinite() squishing infinite values range. trans Deprecated favour transform. call call used construct scale reporting messages. super super class use constructed scale low Colour low end gradient high Colour high end gradient mid colour mid point midpoint midpoint (data value) diverging scale. Defaults 0. space colour space calculate gradient. Must "Lab" - values deprecated. guide Type legend. Use "colourbar" continuous colour bar, "legend" discrete colour legend. na.value Colour use missing values aesthetics Character string vector character strings listing name(s) aesthetic(s) scale works . can useful, example, apply colour settings colour fill aesthetics time, via aesthetics = c("colour", "fill").

title: redefine ggplot2::scale_fill_gradient2() — scale_fill_gradient2
text: Thierry Onkelinx, Oona Op de Weerdt, Nicole De Groof

title: redefine ggplot2::scale_colour_viridis_d() — scale_colour_viridis_d
text: Selects colours depending current set theme.

title: redefine ggplot2::scale_colour_viridis_d() — scale_colour_viridis_d
code: scale_colour_viridis_d(   ...,   alpha = 1,   begin = 0,   end = 1,   direction = 1,   option = "D",   aesthetics = "colour" )  scale_fill_viridis_d(   ...,   alpha = 1,   begin = 0,   end = 1,   direction = 1,   option = "D",   aesthetics = "fill" )

title: redefine ggplot2::scale_colour_viridis_d() — scale_colour_viridis_d
text: ... Arguments passed continuous_scale scale_name name scale used error messages associated scale. palette palette function called numeric vector values 0 1 returns corresponding output values (e.g., scales::pal_area()). breaks One : NULL breaks waiver() default breaks computed transformation object numeric vector positions function takes limits input returns breaks output (e.g., function returned scales::extended_breaks()). Note position scales, limits provided scale expansion. Also accepts rlang lambda function notation. minor_breaks One : NULL minor breaks waiver() default breaks (one minor break major break) numeric vector positions function given limits returns vector minor breaks. Also accepts rlang lambda function notation. function two arguments, given limits major breaks. n.breaks integer guiding number major breaks. algorithm may choose slightly different number ensure nice break labels. effect breaks = waiver(). Use NULL use default number breaks given transformation. labels One : NULL labels waiver() default labels computed transformation object character vector giving labels (must length breaks) expression vector (must length breaks). See ?plotmath details. function takes breaks input returns labels output. Also accepts rlang lambda function notation. limits One : NULL use default scale range numeric vector length two providing limits scale. Use NA refer existing minimum maximum function accepts existing (automatic) limits returns new limits. Also accepts rlang lambda function notation. Note setting limits positional scales remove data outside limits. purpose zoom, use limit argument coordinate system (see coord_cartesian()). rescaler function used scale input values range [0, 1]. always scales::rescale(), except diverging n colour gradients (.e., scale_colour_gradient2(), scale_colour_gradientn()). rescaler ignored position scales, always use scales::rescale(). Also accepts rlang lambda function notation. oob One : Function handles limits outside scale limits (bounds). Also accepts rlang lambda function notation. default (scales::censor()) replaces bounds values NA. scales::squish() squishing bounds values range. scales::squish_infinite() squishing infinite values range. trans Deprecated favour transform. call call used construct scale reporting messages. super super class use constructed scale alpha alpha transparency, number [0,1], see argument alpha hsv. begin, end (corrected) hue [0,1] color map begins ends. direction Sets order colors scale. 1, default, colors ordered darkest lightest. -1, order colors reversed. option character string indicating color map option use. Eight options available: "magma" ("") "inferno" ("B") "plasma" ("C") "viridis" ("D") "cividis" ("E") "rocket" ("F") "mako" ("G") "turbo" ("H") aesthetics Character string vector character strings listing name(s) aesthetic(s) scale works . can useful, example, apply colour settings colour fill aesthetics time, via aesthetics = c("colour", "fill").

what: The theme in compliance with the INBO style guide version >= 2015. — theme_inbo
title: The theme in compliance with the INBO style guide version >= 2015. — theme_inbo
text: theme compliance INBO style guide version >= 2015.

title: The theme in compliance with the INBO style guide version >= 2015. — theme_inbo
code: theme_inbo(base_size = 12, base_family = "", transparent = FALSE)  theme_inbo2015(base_size = 12, base_family, transparent = FALSE)

title: The theme in compliance with the INBO style guide version >= 2015. — theme_inbo
text: base_size base font size, given pts. base_family base font family transparent Make backgrounds transparent. FALSE: backgrounds white, TRUE: backgrounds transparent. can pass vector transparent. case, check whether values "plot", "panel" /"legend" present. according items transparent. Transparent panel use grey instead white grid lines.

title: The theme in compliance with the INBO style guide version >= 2015. — theme_inbo
text: Thierry Onkelinx, Oona Op de Weerdt, Nicole De Groof

title: The theme in compliance with the INBO style guide version >= 2015. — theme_inbo
code: library(ggplot2)   p <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = mpg, y = drat)) + geom_point()   p.inbo <- p + theme_inbo()

title: INBOtheme 0.6.1
text: Update code remove warning deprecated arguments ggplot2. inbo_palette() displays warning message number colours interactive session. Add missing captions vignette. Update checklist machinery.

title: INBOtheme 0.6.0
text: Update inbo_palette() new colours. Change order colour vlaanderen_palette(). theme_inbo() theme_vlaanderen2015() get different colours ordinal data, gradient gradient midpoint. Add show_palette() improve demo_palette(). Split vignette vignette palettes one themes. Defunct functions deprecated previous version. Deprecate functions related NARA. conflicted::conflicts_prefer() prefer INBOmd scale functions original ggplot2 versions.

title: INBOtheme 0.5.11
text: Bugfix scale_colour_gradient2() scale_fill_gradient2().

title: INBOtheme 0.5.10
text: showtext::showtext_auto() rendered fonts much small raster images. showtext::showtext_auto() converts text paths vector formats instead embedding font keep text . makes files much heavier. makes hard edit files afterwards. Upgrade Roxygen 7.1.2

title: INBOtheme 0.5.9
text: Use defaults fonts. Calibri theme_inbo() theme_nara(), FlandersArtSans theme_vlaanderen2015().

title: INBOtheme 0.5.8
text: Add traffic_palette(). Use traffic_palette() default ordinal palettes.

title: INBOtheme 0.5.7
text: Removed colours oldest theme (use 2014). Rename objects match snake_case coding style. Add theme_nara() nara_palette().

title: INBOtheme 0.5.6
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package.
